meanings.definition: The quality or state of being marked with spots.
meanings.sent1: The dalmatian's spottiness made it easily recognizable at the dog park.
meanings.sent2: The spottiness of the leopard's coat helped it blend into the jungle.
meanings.sent3: The spottiness of the cow's fur made it look like a walking checkerboard.
meanings.sent4: The spottiness of the night sky was like a canvas dotted with stars.
meanings.sent5: The spottiness of the ladybug's wings was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The presence of spots or patches on something.
meanings.sent1: The spottiness of the banana indicated it was ripe and ready to eat.
meanings.sent2: The spottiness of the old map made it difficult to read the details.
meanings.sent3: The spottiness of the pavement was caused by years of wear and tear.
meanings.sent4: The spottiness of the giraffe's coat helped it camouflage in the savanna.
meanings.sent5: The spottiness of the butterfly's wings added to its beauty.

meanings.definition: Inconsistency or irregularity in behavior or performance.
meanings.sent1: The spottiness of the student's grades raised concerns about their progress.
meanings.sent2: The spottiness of the weather made it hard to plan outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: The spottiness of the comedian's jokes kept the audience on their toes.
meanings.sent4: The spottiness of the internet connection caused frustration during the video call.
meanings.sent5: The spottiness of the singer's voice added an unexpected charm to the performance.
